data.title: The official "Some site says this guy is a Yank" detective work thread
data.meta_description:
Darrick-Kobi "Kobie" Morris, a '95, appears to be in the mix at NK Zagreb:
http://nkzagreb.hr/main.asp?dir=vijest&vijestid=256
Transfermarkt lists...
data.text:
Nice find. I think you meant this for the last link(?):

http://www.fussball-talente.com/Bild_einsenden-3_24-114066-1.html

2nd from the right in the back row:

Transfermarkt now says two U19s at Ludwigshafener SC in Germany are "Amis." One is Marcus Hawk, who I've had on a watchlist for a while (he was at Kaiserslautern at one time), and the other is Malcolm Little, who I've never heard of. They are both listed with the club for the upcoming "Saison."

http://www.ludwigshafenersc.com/a1_jugendframe.htm

Hawk:

http://www.transfermarkt.co.uk/en/marcus-hawk/profil/spieler_278129.html

Little:

http://www.transfermarkt.co.uk/en/malcolm-little/profil/spieler_278135.html

I started a thread for José de la Tejera here, but he problem belongs in this thread.

As pointed out by Hararea in the Youth Yanks Abroad thread in the Youth National team forum, de la Tejera's Development Academy page lists his nationality as the United States and his country of citizenship as Mexico. The Mexican league site lists his place of origin as Leon, Mexico.

He is part of the Santos Laguna U-20s

Swedish Superettan club IFK Värnamo have announced on their website that they have signed a player named Phathizwe Sacolo. In their news release they describe him as american/south african and he does seem to have played some time in the u.s. but after a quick google he seems to be listed as only south african on other sites. He was also one of the guys touring with a Chicago based team in Sweden recently, looking to get signed.

Thanks for this. Seems unlikely, but I suppose he could have an American parent or parents. Did play some college ball here, as you noted, but came over from South Africa to do so; consequently, his American connections are unclear...

With that said, given that clubs need to know these things for passport/clearance purposes it may be true after all. I'll send the club a note and see if they response.

Transfermarkt says a fellow named Michael Smith playing in Iceland for BI/Bolungarvík is American.

http://www.transfermarkt.co.uk/en/michael-smith/profil/spieler_272425.html

The club doesn't seem to address it.

http://www.bibol.is/mfl_karla/leikmenn/

Wiki thinks he's a Brit. There are several Brits at BI, so that wouldn't surprise me.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BÍ/Bolungarvík

But perhaps somebody here knows more about him?

Pretty sure we can count this guy. I think he's part of the Sonoma State/NorCal ecosystem that routinely sends guys to European teams. (Funny, I think I just looked for him a day or so a go and they hadn't updated their roster online. Nice catch.)

Transfermarkt says a fellow named Mustafa Bazzi is with a club called Nejmeh in Beirut:

http://www.transfermarkt.co.uk/en/mustafa-samir-bazzi/profil/spieler_286769.html

Could be this guy -- Moustafa Bazzi from Michigan:

http://www.detroittitans.com/roster.aspx?rp_id=1519

His college bio doesn't say he wasn't born in the States so it's certainly possible he's ours. Here's the club site, which I cannot read:

http://www.nejmeh-club.com/

The player Dylan Alexis Romney, who Transfermarkt says is American, is currently on loan to Varese (Primavera I think) from Inter. Some other database sites also seem to indicate he's American, but I'm not sure how. Anybody know? (I have sent a note to Varese in hopes of finding out.)

This site has him born 8/7/92 in Dearborn, MI:

http://www.footballdatabase.eu/football.joueurs.moustafa.bazzi.209497.en.html

Good enough?

This dude (pretty reliable source) says he is a Yank:

Transfermarkt lists Nigerian-born '88 striker Badum Maaloo of Germany's Waldhof Mannheim II (5th tier - Badischer Fussballerverband) as American:

http://www.transfermarkt.co.uk/en/badum-maaloo/profil/spieler_255482.html

As do a couple of other sites:

http://www.fussball-talente.com/Badum_Maaloo-3_7-129855-1.html

http://www.cvgoal.com/en/footballer/badum-maaloo/1/

Full name Badum Django Maaloo, seems like English is his first language:

https://twitter.com/NaijaRisto

Any thread on him will have to take full advantage of that middle name.

There is a Badum Maaloo who came to the US at about the right age as a refugee in 1999 (see p. 10):

http://www.ucc.org/assets/pdfs/rj.pdf

I'm thinking that's probably him. Not the most common name in the US among boys that age.

He's already come up several times in the Adam Afghani thread:

Adam Afghani in Germany
